title: Stability in complex food webs
text:
How biodiversity determines temporal stability is a central question in ecology. This question has been adressed quite a lot in grasslands and other species assemblages. However, the effects of food-web have been overlooked.
Trophic interactions, by their effects of biomass fluxes, can have tremendous effects on community stability. For example, generalist predators can stabilise their preys.

I am currently in post-doc at the University of Sheffield (UK) in Pr Andrew Beckerman’s lab. I am mainly working on how food web structure affect community stability and affect their response to environmental pressures. I also work my research interests cover biodiversity trends and positive interactions among species.
You can have a look at my reseach projects and my publications. You can retrieve my work on google scholar and research gate.
You can reach me at a.h.danet[at]sheffield.ac.uk.
